word[0]: be in a muddle/get into a muddle
example[0]: I’m in such a muddle, I’d completely forgotten you were coming today.
example[1]: My grandmother tends to get into a muddle over names.
note[0]: be in a muddle/get into a muddle over/about
definition[1]: to be untidy or in a disorganized state
example[2]: Sorry about the mess – we’re in a bit of a muddle at the moment.
example[3]: All my files have got into a muddle somehow.
